relatedanime.anime: The Idolmaster Movie: Kagayaki no Mukougawa e!

similaranime.anime: Wake Up, Girls! Shichinin no Idol

recommendations.recommendation:
I like it, since I am a fan of the series. You probably won`t like it because this is probably the first introduction to the IM series and the story "lacks" and there splitting of air time between the girls are quite sparce.
Probably your choice would be Love Live, rather than this one... iono, never saw Love Live
I was put off by all the high pitch voices at first, but once all the characters got introduced, I began to enjoy it. Quite liked it by the end, when the drama built up.

One of my favorite , enjoyable and make me think positive.
Don`t underestimate by looking, just go and watch it till end you may become a Huge fan like me.

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr3512 [Bandai Namco Games]` raising simulation and rhythm game by the same name, in which players assume the role of producers and lead http://anidb.net/t2438 [idols] under their care to fame and stardom. THE IDOLM@STER follows 13 girls from the 765 Production Studio, whose sole goal is to become the top idols in the Japanese entertainment industry. Along with the laughs, struggles and tears that are inherently part of this journey, you will cheer for the girls of IDOLM@STER as they climb their way to the top! Source: Crunchyroll

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: ojou-sama laugh
tag.description: A type of haughty laughter typical of rich young girls, as well as older rich women. Generally sounds like a high-pitched "OHOHOHOHOHOHO".

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: performance
tag.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: Newtype Anime Award
tag.description: This anime has won 1 or more Newtype Anime Award(s)

tag.name: real-world location
tag.description: Places seen in the show exist in reality. Note: This could be sometime in the future, though names and certain places will still be recognizable.

tag.name: important haircut
tag.description: When a character cuts off his or her hair, it often symbolizes a rite of passage or bout of character growth. A princess striking out on an adventure, or a new recruit at boot camp, for instance. Hair is something that takes time and effort to grow, so parting with it voluntarily can be a powerful act. This is particularly a big deal when women get haircuts. Yet in fiction, even an accidental hair slicing can leave a character with a surprisingly even cut. In many religions (Western Christianity, Ancient Egyptian religion, and others) priests and/or monks cut/shave their hair. Roman Catholic nuns also tend to cut and mantain their hair short under their veils when they enter the nunneries. The cutting of one`s own hair is also a part of Buddhist mythology, specifically something done by Siddhartha himself early on in his path to enlightenment, so anime examples might draw from this as an allusion. There are also some cultures, including Native American and many Asians, where a person would cut his or her hair as an act of grief, disgrace, or even rebellion. In the Confucian tradition, hair (like the rest of your body) is considered a gift from your parents and may not be damaged without a very good reason. Furthermore, prisoners and psychiatric patients commonly have their heads shaved, often to prevent the spread of lice, but sometimes also as a demeaning measure. Source: TVTRope

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: remastered version available
tag.description: This anime has been remastered in a higher quality format than the original release. The remaster may be a simple upscale, or it could be a full enhancement project from the original frames. This is irrespective of whether specific groups have released rips of such formats to the internet.

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: filmmaking
tag.description: Filmmaking is the process of making a film. This may be tied to studios with very large budgets or to inexpensive independent products alike, and even to amateur films; modern technology allows people to film events of significance in their lives, such as their marriages. Anime in school settings may have a film club, which sometimes produce their own films for e.g. the school culture festival.

tag.name: OP and ED sung by characters
tag.description: OP and/or ED in this anime is sung by the characters and animation shows them singing.

tag.name: hard work and guts
tag.description: One of the character`s motto in the anime. Because there is nothing that cannot be achieved by hard work and guts.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: dreams and reality
tag.description: This genre of anime is typically set in both the world as we know it (reality) and a world of dreams, mythology or imagination. Sometimes this dreamworld is actually real, sometimes it is not. Other times what we think is the real world is the dreamworld, and vice versa. They are not always easy to distinguish from each other, neither by the characters nor the viewer. Whatever is real, and whatever is reality, both worlds are integral in shaping both the plot of this anime and the development of the characters.

tag.name: it`s funny because they`re poor
tag.description: A character`s relative lack of wealth is used as a source of humour.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: show within a show
tag.description: A fictional TV (or radio, or stage) show that takes place within an actual TV show; or, occasionally, a fictional instalment or incarnation of an actual show. Many comedies have short one-off gags where they parody existing shows. Example: A large part of Martian Successor Nadesico is centred around the fictional popular anime Gekigangar III, which is being watched by several characters of the Nadesico crew.

tag.name: product placement
tag.description: Otherwise known as a "plug" or "writing commercials right into a show". The practice of prominently displaying or talking about a recognizable product in a program, in exchange for some consideration from the manufacturer, usually monetary. (Source: TV Tropes) Particularly notorious example, Pizza Hut for the involvement with Code Geass, Darker than Black and other series.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: cute girls doing cute things
tag.description:
Cute girls doing cute things with each other (CGDCT): when girls are super friendly with each other and do all sorts of http://anidb.net/t798 [cute/moe] things with each other, but there is no yuri or shoujo ai subtext -- more specifically, there is no romantic subtext.
* CGDCT applies where the main focus is on moe/cute girls and their interactions with each other. Good examples include http://anidb.net/a9722 [Non Non Biyori] (600 weight / 3.0 stars) and http://anidb.net/a9579 [Kin`iro Mosaic] (600 weight / 3.0 stars). * Generally, CGDCT is applicable only if the anime is also tagged predominantly female cast or all female cast. * CGDCT does not apply if girls doing cute things is incidental to a larger motive/theme/meta. For example, in http://anidb.net/a8168 [Nichijou] the focus is comedy, using cute girls; the tag would not apply.
CGDCT is often mistaken as low level yuri or shoujo ai. If there is also actual romantic subtext, use the http://anidb.net/t2695 [yuri (18+)] and http://anidb.net/t2782 [shoujo ai] tags as well. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

character.name: 765 Production
character.description: 765 Production is the fictional studio which created the iDOLM@STER project, featuring a group of 10 new idols.

character.name: Kisha
character.description: A reporter.

character.name: Amagase Touma
character.description: Amagase Touma is the leader of the boygroup Jupiter.

character.name: Shikaisha
character.description: Frog moderator of Gero Gero Kitchen TV Show.

character.name: Director
character.description: Director of Gero Gero Kitchen TV Show.

character.name: Obaa-chan
character.description: An old woman from hot-spring inn.

character.name: Event Kantoku
character.description: A director of event where Makoto and Ganaha should have danced.

character.name: Cameraman
character.description: A cameraman who took a photo of Takane in ep 6.

character.name: Hamuzou
character.description: Hamuzou is Hibiki`s hamster. He gives her advices often.

character.name: Yakinikuman
character.description: Yakinikuman is a hero from TV show.

character.name: Reporter
character.description: Reporter who had little interview with Iori in front of her house.

character.name: Takatsuki Kasumi
character.description: Kasumi is the third oldest child of Takatsuki family.

character.name: Takatsuki Kouji
character.description: Kouji is fifth child of Takatsuki family.

character.name: Takatsuki Koutarou
character.description: Koutarou is the fourth oldest child of Takatsuki family.

character.name: Takatsuki Chousuke
character.description: Chousuke is the second oldest child of Takatsuki family.

character.name: Ryuuguu Komachi
character.description: Ryuuguu Komachi is a idol group consisting of http://anidb.net/ch6297 [Miura Azusa], http://anidb.net/ch6294 [Futami Ami] and http://anidb.net/ch6299 [Minase Iori].

character.name: Uranaishi
character.description: Fortune teller with stomach ache.

character.name: Sekiyuou
character.description: An oil baron who came to Japan to get married.

character.name: Henshuusha
character.description: An editor.

character.name: Rouba
character.description: Old woman who got lost.

character.name: Rouba no Musuko
character.description: A son of old woman.

character.name: Hanayome
character.description: A bride who doesn`t want to get married.

character.name: Dance Koushi
character.description: Dance instructor.

character.name: Radio DJ
character.description: A guy who interwieved Ryuuguuu Komachi in radio.

character.name: Satsujinhan
character.description: A murderer from TV drama in which Ryuuguu Komachi played three sisters.

character.name: Tsubame
character.description: Tsubame is the member of idol group Shinkan Shoujo. She is named after express train Tsubame.

character.name: Nozomi
character.description: Nozomi is the member of idol group Shinkan Shoujo. She is named after shinkansen Nozomi.

character.name: Hikari
character.description: Hikari is the leader of idol group Shinkan Shoujo. She is named after shinkansen Hikari.

character.name: Ijuuin Hokuto
character.description: Ijuuin Hokuto is the member of the boygroup Jupiter.

character.name: Mitarai Shouta
character.description: Mitarai Shouta is the member of the boygroup Jupiter.

character.name: Shinkan Shoujo Producer
character.description: Producer of the idol group Shinkan Shoujo.

character.name: Hidaka Ai
character.description: Hidaka Ai is the member of 876 Production.

character.name: Mizutani Eri
character.description: Mizutani Eri is the member of 876 Production.

character.name: Akizuki Ryou
character.description: Akizuki Ryou is the cousin of Akizuki Ritsuko and an idol from 876 Production. He is calm, soft, and all-around a cool and collected boy. In many ways, he is the opposite of his sometimes-harsh cousin. He carries an air of femininity, due to which he tends to be asked out by male classmates. Deeply worried by his feminine image and hoping to become more popular with the girls, Ryou has been considering becoming an idol for a long time, but when he visits the 765 Production office to discuss this idea with his cousin Ritsuko, she appears skeptical towards his plans. However, she is prepared to introduce him to Okamoto Manami, a manager at 876 Production. Manami, in deep trouble because of an 876 idol having become unable to perform at a live that is about to take place, is glad to accept Ryou as a substitute. Much to his disturbance, he has to go on stage dressed as a girl. Ritsuko, noticing Ryou`s charming on-stage appearance, decides that he should make his debut with 765 Production after all. Ryou immediately refuses because Ritsuko wants him to debut as a girl idol, and he does not like the idea of being toyed with by his cousin. He chooses to join 876 Production instead so he will be able to debut in his own way. However, when he is officially being taken in by 876 Production, president Ishikawa decides that Ryou will continue to perform as a female idol for the time being. His fans and his fellow 876 idols Hidaka Ai and Mizutani Eri are not aware that Ryou is actually male. Source: iM@S wiki

character.name: Kuroi Takao
character.description: Kuroi Takao is 961 Productions president.

character.name: Jupiter
character.description: Jupiter is a boygroup consisting of http://anidb.net/ch34681 [Amagase Touma], http://anidb.net/ch36542 [Ijuuin Hokuto] and http://anidb.net/ch36543 [Mitarai Shouta].

character.name: Dance Coach
character.description: Dance coach for choreography for new song.

character.name: Voice Trainer
character.description: Voice trainer for the new song.

character.name: Interviewer
character.description: A guy who made an interview with Miki on the street.

character.name: Bangumi Director
character.description: Director of program Break Out! Animal World`s Animal Explorer Squad in which Hibiki is the main emcee.

character.name: Shikai
character.description: A moderator of special show Congregation of Hot Young Noblemen in which guests are Jupiter and Makoto.

character.name: Elder Records Shachou
character.description: President of Elder Records.

character.name: Josei Kisha
character.description: Female who made an interview with Takane.

character.name: Shibusawa Kisha
character.description: Reporter who is looking for compromising photos of 765 Pro for Kuroi Takao.

character.name: Ishi
character.description: A doctor who examined Chihaya.

character.name: Kisaragi Yuu
character.description: Chihaya`s little brother. He is dead.

character.name: Kisaragi Chigusa
character.description: Chihaya`s mother.

character.name: Kisaragi Chihaya
character.description: Chihaya as a child.

character.name: Amami Haruka
character.description: Haruka as a child.

character.name: Shindou
character.description: Shindou is a butler serving in Minase house.

episode.title: これからが彼女たちのはじまり
The Beginning for the Girls
Kore kara ga Kanojo-tachi no Hajimari
episode.summary: In Tokyo, there is 765 Productions; they have 12 rookie idols and producers who are working toward their dreams. One morning a cameraman was tasked to captured a day in the life at 765 Productions, what he saw will surprise you and the idols. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先に進むという選択
The Choice to Move Forward
Saki ni Susumu to Iu Sentaku
episode.summary: Ritsuko`s new idol group`s hot debut, Ryuuguu Komachi. The group`s members, Iori, Ami, Azusa are so busy with meet & greets, television appearances, and releasing their new debut song, they don`t have time to do anything else. But the other idols, in comparison, have nothing to do at all. The producer starts to panic seeing what`s going on, and promises to get the girls a bunch of work, but all of that enthusiasm doesn`t exactly pay off... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなとすごす夏休み
Spending Summer Vacation With Everyone
Minna to Sugosu Natsuyasumi
episode.summary: The air conditioning is broken in 765 Pro`s office and it`s like a sauna. To escape the heat, they decide to take a company trip to the beach. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 自分を変えるということ
Trying to Change Oneself
Jibun o Kaeru to Iu Koto
episode.summary: Four of the girls are going to appear on the cable TV show Ribbit Ribbit Kitchen. Each of the idols show off their specialties as the producer watches, but Chihaya has trouble with the comedy-like style of the program. And then when she learns that the program` format has changed so she won`t be singing, she gets even more unhappy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: すべては一歩の勇気から
Everything Starts with One Courageous Step
Subete wa Ippo no Yuuki kara
episode.summary: The 765 idols land themselves a mini-concert at a summer event! All of them are excited because it`ll be the first time in a while they all get to perform together and they even get to sing. They all head towards the village where they`re going to perform with high hopes, but when they arrive, they find themselves deep in the mountains, in a village with an extremely rural feel. The youth organization that comes to greet them, filled with men, only further amplifies Yukiho`s stage fright... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: "準備"をはじめた少女たち
The Girls Who Began "Preparations"
"Junbi" o Hajimeta Shoujo-tachi
episode.summary: The girls’ promo photos aren’t that great, and the idea to re-take them in a more natural way has been proposed. While the girls try to establish their individuality, Iorin, Ami, Mami, and Yayoi develop a plan to outshine them all. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなで, 少しでも前へ
Moving Forward a Little Bit, With Everyone
Minna de, Sukoshi de mo Mae e
episode.summary: 765 Production is participating in the Talent Agency Track Meet, held once a year, because of Ryuuguu Komachi`s success. They all work together to take first in the idol category, but they find themselves vying for the position with Shinkan Shoujo, an extremely popular idol group. Then, one of Shinkan Shoujo`s members says something harsh to Yayoi, causing her to become depressed... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふたりだから出来ること
Things You Can Do As Two
Futari Dakara Dekiru Koto
episode.summary: It`s afternoon when Ryuuguu Komachi completed the shooting for a detective drama when something happens that shakes the very core of 765 Production. Iori bought some extremely rare pudding as a present for herself and the other members of the office, and now it`s gone missing! Ami and Mami are now on the case searching for the person who ate their pudding. They embark on their quest, but you`ll never guess who did it... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しあわせへの回り道
A Detour Toward Happiness
Shiawase e no Mawarimichi
episode.summary: Azusa, Miki and Makoto take up a modeling job in a church for a wedding magazine. The three of them are dressed up and Azusa is pleased with her wedding dress. But men in black show up during the shoot and take Azusa away. They were looking for a bride and got the wrong person, and even though the issue is solved right away, Azusa is left behind, lost, and can`t find her way... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大好きなもの, 大切なもの
Things You Love, Things That Are Important
Daisuki na Mono, Taisetsu na Mono
episode.summary: Through an unexpected turn of events, Iori and Hibiki end up eating dinner at Yayoi`s house. Yayoi`s the eldest daughter in her large family, so she helps out making food and taking care of her younger brothers and sisters because her parents get home late. Today they`re having their Bean Sprout Day that they have every week, so the two of them stop to get a lot of bean spouts during a sale at the supermarket and head towards Yayoi`s house. Yayoi`s happy family greet them, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一方通行の終着点
The Last Stop on a One Way Ride
Ippou Tsuukou no Shuuchakuten
episode.summary: Miki realizes the conversation she had with the producer when he told her that she could get into Ryuuguu Komachi if she tries hard is a misunderstanding. Miki has a loss of momentum and willpower and stops showing up to practice for their concert and doesn`t even come in to check her outfit for the event. The producer struggles to find Miki, realizing just how much he hurt Miki with his careless remark, but she... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 期待, 不安, そして予兆
Hopes, Uncertainties, and Signs
Kitai, Fuan, Soshite Yochou
episode.summary: 765 Production finally gets their own concert! It`ll mainly feature Ryuuguu Komachi, but the rest of the idols will also make an apperance. Everyone`s ecstatic. So they all get started practicing dancing and singing for the event. But each idol has their own talents. Everyone wants to do their best for the concert and not simplify things so that all members can participate, but certain members start getting warn out... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ひとりぼっちの気持ち
The Feeling of Being Alone
Hitoribocchi no Kimochi
episode.summary: Hibiki and Inumi are fighting leading to only one showing up for today’s shoot. In the meantime 961 productions have come up with a new scheme to destroy a 765 Idol. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんな揃って, 生放送ですよ生放送!
Everyone Together, it`s a Live Broadcast! A Live Broadcast!
Minna Sorotte, Namahousou Desu yo Namahousou!
episode.summary: The 765 idols appear in a live show "Live?! On Sundays." Haruka, Miki and Chihaya anchor the program. Hibiki has a segement where she attempts some sort of challenge every week. Yukiho has a "Let`s Change Kikuchi Makoto" segement, and Ami and Mami have short skits that they do--there`s a bunch going on in this show. The idols show their stuff while crazy things happen because it`s all live! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 変わりはじめた世界!
The World Has Begun to Change!
Kawari Hajimeta Sekai!
episode.summary: Ever since the concert and raving article, the Idols have become popular to the point they have to wear disguises. While waiting for see the cover of a magazine staring all the Idols, they are shocked to learn their rivals Jupiter are on it. What has happened? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: そして, 彼女たちはきらめくステージへ
And So, the Girls Head to the Sparkling Stage
Soshite, Kanojo-tachi wa Kirameku Stage e
episode.summary: It`s time for 765 Production`s concert! The idols are excited and nervous about their first big concert. But the members of Ryuuguu Komachi were at a small concert in the countryside and got caught in a typhoon. The bullet trains have stopped running, and they`re not sure they can make it back. Everybody starts to get really worried. Will their concert be a success? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雲間に隠れる月の如く
Like the Moon, Hidden Among Clouds
Kumoma ni Kakureru Tsuki no Gotoku
episode.summary: A paparazzi hired by 961 Production is following Takane Shijou. She is photographed spending time with owner of Elder Records. Is she ready to leave 765 Production? What?! Chihaya has lost her voice? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たくさんの, いっぱい
Full of Many Things
Takusan no, Ippai
episode.summary: Ritsuko is pushing Ryuuguu Komachi hard for their upcoming secret concert. Unfortunately Azusa is sick and can’t perform. Who can fill in on such short notice… Ritsuko?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真, まことの王子様
Makoto, A True Prince
Makoto, Makoto no Ouji-sama
episode.summary: Makoto is considered a prince among her female fans, but she wants to be a princess. A chance date with Producer might make those feelings come true. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 私
I
Watashi
episode.summary: The idols are practicing for their New Year’s concert but the schedule makes it nearly impossible. And the bad news won’t stop, Live, On Sundays! Is being cancelled! Can it get worst…? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 聖夜の夜に
On the Night of the Holy Night
Seiya no Yoru ni
episode.summary: The idols of 765 Production have been working nonstop thanks to their Producer. But because of all that work they haven’t been able to spend time as a group. So Haruka and Producer try to do the impossible and have a staff Christmas party. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: まるで花が咲くように
Like a Flower Blooming
Maru de Hana ga Saku You ni
episode.summary: Chihaya is able to stand in front of a crowd once again after receiving help from her friends and Haruka. She gives an interview about what really happened in her past so she can get back to work. 765 is now stronger than ever, but Kuroi of 961 Production isn`t pleased about that fact and plans to set his final trap in a concert the girls and Jupiter will appear in. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束
Promise
Yakusoku
episode.summary: An article appears in a gossip magazine about Chihaya`s past. It was about Chihaya`s late-younger brother and her now-divorced parents. Due to the shock from the article, laced with malice, Cihhaya loses her voice. As she has lost her voice, she does not want to continue to be an idol and stops going to the office. Haruka, worried, visits Chihaya in her apartment where she lives alone... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなと, いっしょに!
Together With Everyone!
Minna to, Issho ni!
episode.summary: The day of the New Year’s concert finally comes. The producer is still recovering and when Kotori goes to check in on him, he asks a favor of her. Meanwhile, the idols are excited that this will be the largest concert they`ve ever done, and each of them have now found what it means to be an idol to them. 765 Production finally stand on stage together for this large production. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夢
Dream
Yume
episode.summary: With the producer in the hospital things have changed around 765 Production. The once cheerful Hark has lost faith in being an Idol, and her sadness casts a shadow among the girls. Who will bring back the light? Source: crunchyroll
